instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- works fine with charger but slow on battery
threads.message:
hi guys,
liquid damage machine , cleaned and replaced isl twice , checked with few batteries but no luck. the problem is that it works fine when charger is plugged in but if charger is not plugged in it becomes slow and jerky , but as soon as the charger is plugged in it becomes completely fine.
( i have this issue with 2 more machines but the other one i believe is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but i will check it to confirm and may be will open another thread for that later on )

kindly advise
thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- works fine with charger but slow on battery
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- works fine with charger but slow on battery
threads.message:
ok , will update you tomorrow after changing it 
thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- works fine with charger but slow on battery
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> has nothing to do with that!

Run ASD and check for sensor issues. Likely corrosion around <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>/10 area.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- works fine with charger but slow on battery
threads.message: Duke is right, I read wrong, sorry for that....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- works fine with charger but slow on battery
threads.message:
hi guys, 
                         thanks for the reply , just finished fixing the traces of <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR> and now it is completely working fine , 
thanks both of you for advice 
we can now put this thread as solved
